aka.commentary: This word is deprecated by the creator, replaced by "natu".
aka.definition: 十字形、交叉、重疊［ natu 嘅另類形式］
aka.etymology: 过 (guò): 普通話, 過; across: 英文, 跨越

ako.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community.

aku.etymology: acru: 羅馬尼亞文, 酸

alente.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
alente.definition: 任何現有嘅 toki pona 字入面唔包含嘅任何概念
alente.etymology: ale ante: 托基波納 (toki pona), 其他所有嘢

alu.definition: (粒子)［放喺主句之後，引入上下文短語］
alu.etymology: la: 托基波納 (toki pona), （指出句子嘅上下文）

an.etymology: 函 (hán): 中國人, 某啲嘢嘅位置，插槽，通道，插座，屋企；文字嘅段落；插槽入去，啱晒

antikontitutonelema.commentary: several -ti- syllables. If desired, one can change one (especially the first) or all “ti” to "te" for a more classical toki pona phonology.

apelo.commentary: the drinks need not be alcoholic, usually involve snacks too.
apelo.definition: unwinding with friends over a drink/cocktail (or two)
apelo.etymology: apéro: French, apéritif (alcoholic drink served before a meal as an appetiser)

apoko.definition: 💀 表情符號； Toki Pona 改編嘅 meme 「I forgor」

awase.commentary: jan Lenoka further elaborated the semantics to imply "to bump into, to make contact with".

eki.commentary: It is recommended to use "natu" instead.
eki.definition: 十字形、交叉、重疊［ natu 嘅另類形式］

eliki.commentary: an experience with the quality of being deeply felt or important to oneself while defying classification as positive, negative, or a simply described admixture of positive and negative
eliki.definition: trial, adversity; bittersweet; an experience with the quality of being deeply felt or important to oneself while defying classification as positive, negative, or a simply described admixture of positive and negative

enko.commentary:
Considered deprecated by the author: "mi pali e nimi enko a a
open la pilin mi li sama
nimi enko li pona, jan mute o kepeken
taso kepeken pi toki pona la mi kama sona
nimi ante li ken toki e wile toki pi nimi enko
la ona li suli ala"
enko.definition: (spatial equivalents of tenpo constructions) space, place, distance, size (length, width, height, depth, area, volume)
enko.etymology: tenpo: 托基波納 (toki pona), time, period, situation

epikule.commentary: Also known as kulepiku. Basically just a compound glyph that happened to be listed as a word.
epikule.etymology: kule epiku: 托基波納 (toki pona)

ete.etymology: öte: Turkish, beyond, further, over; ettë: Quenya, outside

ewe.etymology: 岩 (iwa): Japanese, rock, boulder; kiwen: 托基波納 (toki pona), rock, stone, hard thing

i.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "i" was proposed as a replacement for the now-archaic third-person pronoun "iki". However, it failed to get enough votes.
i.definition: 佢，佢哋［喺2002年被選為替代第三人稱代名詞］

iki.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "iki" was deemed too similar to "ike" and replaced by "ona".
iki.definition: 佢，佢哋［2002年嘅第三人稱代名詞，喺民調中用 啊「ona」取代］
iki.etymology: იგი (igi): 格魯吉亞文, (third-person singular masculine, feminine, and gender neutral pronoun)

inta.commentary: A particle that allows the speaker to specify the level of information they have about a situation. As a modifier, it means "at least" or "definitely", indicating knowledge of one thing but not necessarily other things.

ipi.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "ipi" was proposed as a replacement for the now-archaic third-person pronoun "iki". However, it failed to get enough votes.
ipi.definition: 佢，佢哋［喺2002年被選為替代第三人稱代名詞］

iseki.commentary: Intended as an alt for namako that removes the "additional, extra" definition. used to emphasize that these details are core to something, and not superfluous.
iseki.definition: 花卉；配飾、裝飾、香料；觀賞性、美觀、繁盛

itomi.commentary: Coined in reference to the song ‘Mia Khalifa’ by iLOVEFRiDay, where "hit or miss" was a prominent lyric. Sources disagree on who coined the word.
itomi.etymology: hit or miss: 英文, hit or miss

iwa.definition: malodorous chemical substance, such as sulfur, hydrogen sulfide, chlorine gas, bromine, white phosphorus, or selenide compounds

ja.commentary: Can also be combined with lo to mark modified or compound prepositions, marking the end of a preposition marked by lo and the start of the prepositional object.
ja.definition: (particle) [marks the previous word(s) as a single preverb]

jalan.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "jalan" was proposed as a replacement for "noka". However, it failed to get enough votes.
jalan.definition: foot, leg [polled as a replacement for noka in 2002]
jalan.etymology: jalan: Finnish, afoot; jalka: Finnish, foot

jans.commentary: Not coined directly, but developed out of repeated use in the early ma pona pi toki pona Discord server community. jans was repeatedly used because of the humor in adding an English plural suffix to a Toki Pona word.
jans.definition: a particular group of early members of the ma pona pi toki pona Discord server
jans.etymology: jan: 托基波納 (toki pona), person, people; -/z/: 英文, (plural suffix)

jepi.commentary: Coined indepentently multiple times over several years, non-wuwojiti variant of the word jipi.

jipi.commentary: Coined indepentently multiple times over several years.

josuta.commentary: josuta is not the same as ko. or kiwen. or telo. It is its own thing. josuta covers the concepts of elasticity, the quality of things that are rubbery, and stretchy; elasticity. This is not to be confused with ko. josuta is a seperate thing, that is, in any way, not covered by "ko", "telo", "kiwen", or "suwi".

ju.definition: (word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)

jule.definition: indeterminate, inconclusive, tentative; unpredictable, unstable, volatile; to waver; to vibrate, to tremble, to wobble, to shake
jule.etymology: 揺れる (yureru): Japanese, shake, vibrate, oscillate, waver

jume.commentary: Experimental, to see how the meaning could be expanded, but never actually used. No set of meanings was ever settled on before stopping the experiment, but one potential meaning the creator particularly liked was "fantasy" or "unreality", without a negative connotation.

jupi.commentary: Coined indepentently multiple times over several years. Non-wuwojiti variant of the word jipi that has mostly overtaken it in use.
jupi.definition: yippee, woohoo (interjection indicating excitement, joy or happiness); to celebrate, to win; autism, autistic, ADHD, neurodivergent, spectrum, to stim
jupi.etymology: yupi: Spanish, yippee; yippee: English, yippee; .ui: Lojban, happiness

ka.definition: (replacement for li, marked for future tense)
ka.etymology: ka: toki sapin, (future tense marker); kama: toki pona, coming

ka1.commentary:
Recoined indepentently multiple times over several years."
Originally created for toki sapin, a short-lived unfinished tokiponido created in January 2021 by jan Posuke. It survived through notes in ma pona pi toki pona, where it was the first thing that came up for "ka".
Created as part of a set with "so" for the past tense, "te" for the present tense, and contractions "miso", "mite", and "mika". Only "ka" has seen significant mention outside of toki sapin.

ka2.commentary: Borrowed from tuki tiki as a replacement for the deprecated konwe.
ka2.definition: living thing, moving being, creature; life, alive
ka2.etymology: ka: tuki tiki, being, person, creature, alive; jan: toki pona, human being, person, somebody

kalamARR.etymology: kalama: 托基波納 (toki pona), make sound. sound, noise, voice; arr: 英文, (imitation of pirates)

kalapisituji.commentary: the orthography of that word is not fixed and any “wuwojiti” is not considered a mistake. In fact, basically anything after kalapis… can be altered and it would still be considered the same word (so go ahead and have fun with kalapisituwi, kalapisituje, kalapisu…, or any form that pleases you).
kalapisituji.definition: scam, utterly nonsensical, muddled and confused (often on purpose)

kalijopilale.definition: member of the order Caryophyllales, including all cacti as well as carnations, beets, and many carnivorous plants

kan.definition: (preposition) with, among, in the company of
kan.etymology: kanssa: Finnish, with; kun: Esperanto, with; cum: Latin, with

kana.commentary: Serves as a non-deprecated, neutral-connotation, and polysemous variant of words like oni, powe, or jume.
kana.definition: dream; trance, hypnosis, hallucination; illusion, fantasy, imaginary; narrative, story, myth

kankuli.etymology: scrunkly: 英文, cute in a quirky, scruffy, or dishevelled way

kapa.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "kapa" was proposed as a replacement for "nena". However, it failed to get enough votes.
kapa.definition: extrusion, protrusion, hill, mountain, button [polled as a replacement for nena in 2002]
kapa.etymology: kop: 荷蘭文, head, cup; kapo: Esperanto, head; caput: Latin, head

kasan.definition: legume, seed, nut, bean, soy, lentils, hard shelled fruit
kasan.etymology: kacang: Malay, bean, nut, peanut, legume

ke.etymology: ’kay: 英文, 好; okay: 英文, 好

kelo.commentary: Part of a system with uka to express the colors seen by someone with protanopia or deuteranopia (red-green colorblindness).
kelo.etymology: kule: toki pona, color, pigment. category, genre, flavor. colorful, diverse; telo: toki pona, liquids e.g. water, gasoline, soda, lava, soup, oil, ink

kepa.commentary: Semantically, "kepa" describes a group or the state of a group rather than the state of one thing in a group.
kepa.definition: pattern, order, sequence, series, rhythm; arrangement, organization, decluttering; weaving, knitting

kepen.commentary: Coined as a shortened version of kepeken by jan Tomen in 2017. Did not see significant use until 2020.
kepen.etymology: kepeken: 托基波納 (toki pona), to use, by means of, with

kese.etymology: קֶשֶׁת (kéšet): Hebrew, named for the Jewish LGBT organization Keshet

kewe.commentary: Part of a system with sunta to express the colors seen by someone with tritanopia (blue-yellow colorblindness).
kewe.etymology: kule: toki pona, color, pigment. category, genre, flavor. colorful, diverse; sewi: toki pona, up, top, above, highest part. divine, sacred, supernatural. awesome, inspiring, excelling

ki.commentary: Provides relativisation of subjects (see WALS 122A), but not relativisation of obliques (see WALS 123A). Unlike ki, more typical relative constructions (usually two clauses linked via ni) support both.

kokoliko.definition: rooster, chicken, birds from the genus Gallus

kolin.etymology: ko olin: 托基波納 (toki pona), gloopy love

kolo.etymology: guruwe: Swahili, 豬; ingulube: Zulu, 豬; ngulu: Kongo, 豬; guarro, gorrino: Spanish, 豬; gorogoro: Japanese, growl; grunt: 英文, grunt

konsi.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community. Apparently used humorously.

konsuno.etymology: kon + suno: 托基波納 (toki pona), calque of English "gaslight"

kosan.definition: guard, protect, defend, shield, brace, fortify from outside

kulaso.etymology: green: 英文, green; laso: 托基波納 (toki pona), blue, green

kulu.definition: [shortened variant of kulupu]; six (particularly in seximal base)
kulu.etymology: kulupu: 托基波納 (toki pona), group, community, collection

kuntu.commentary: Originally an initialism of "kalama musi tan uta" ("kmtu"), meant as an equivalent of English "LOL"; compare the formations of "omen" and "peto".
kuntu.etymology: kulupu musi tan uta: 托基波納 (toki pona), 'fun sound from the mouth', to sing with your voice

kutopoma.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community.
kutopoma.definition: the Korean group chat "kulupu pi toki pona pi ma Anku"
kutopoma.etymology: kulupu pi toki pona pi ma Anku: 托基波納 (toki pona), the Toki Pona community of Korea

lan.commentary: Intended as a replacement for 'jan' in mixed-headnoun groups, or when the headnoun of the person being referred to is unknown.
lan.definition: being, individual; something that exists; anything that can take action itself
lan.etymology: lon: 托基波納 (toki pona), present, existing, real, true. (preposition) located at, in, during, in the context of; wan: 托基波納 (toki pona), (number) one. singular. combine, join, mix, fuse; jan: 托基波納 (toki pona), 人

lijokuku.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community.

likujo.definition: collection, assortment, menagerie, arrangement, handful, harvest; seven
likujo.etymology: recueil: 阿卡迪亞法文, collection, ensemble, anthology

lipasa.commentary: "Coined" by kala Asi for a small-scale survey to see if people would select it.
lipasa.definition: [fake word that doesn't exist, for catching dishonestly filled surveys]
lipasa.etymology: липа (lipa): Russian, linden tree. (colloquial) forgery, fake

lisa.commentary: Coined in response to -isa animal words.

lo.commentary: Previously known as lu. Most of those interested in the word have agreed to change it to lo, to avoid interfering with the reserved word. Can also be combined with ja to mark modified or compound prepositions, with ja marking the end of a preposition marked by lo and the start of the prepositional object.
lo.etymology: alu: 托基波納 (toki pona), (indicate context for a prior sentence)

loka.commentary: Coined in response to jan Sonja's survey, as a portmanteau, presumably as a joke.
loka.etymology: luka: 托基波納 (toki pona), hand, arm, grasping appendage, tactile appendage; noka: 托基波納 (toki pona), foot, leg, roots, locomotive appendage

lokon.definition: [word made as a compromise between "lukin" and "oko"]
lokon.etymology: lukin: 托基波納 (toki pona), look, see, eye. (preverb) try to; oko: 托基波納 (toki pona), look, see, eye. (preverb) try to

lonsi.commentary: Used commonly in ma pona pi toki pona for much of late 2023; no set meaning other than the phrase "lonsi li lonsi".
lonsi.etymology: lon: 托基波納 (toki pona), present, existing, real, true. (preposition) located at, in, during, in the context of; tonsi: 托基波納 (toki pona), nonbinary, gender nonconforming, genderqueer, transgender

lu.definition: (word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)

lu1.etymology: alu: toki pona, (indicate context for a prior sentence)

masenta.etymology: magenta: 英文, purplish-red color; magenta: French, purplish-red color

me.etymology: anu seme: 托基波納 (toki pona), tag question

molusa.definition: squishy animal, e.g., snail, slug, sponge
molusa.etymology: mollusk: 英文, Invertebrae related to snails, slugs, mussels, octopi (scientific nomenclature); mollusca: Latin, thin shelled

natu.definition: relationship, correlation, commonality; cross, knot, junction, intersection; to overlap, to fold; to overstep, to exceed to a point
natu.etymology: ngã tư: Vietnamese, crossroads, four-way intersection

nele.commentary: Meant to be antonymous to the 'cover, layer of privacy' meanings of 'len'. It can be applied both literally and metaphorically.
nele.definition: transparent material/object, lack of privacy; clear, transparent, unobstructed; to make clear, to make transparent, to remove obstructions
nele.etymology: len: 托基波納 (toki pona), cloth, fabric, clothing. secret, hidden, covered

nowi.commentary: Intended as an alt to esun which implies that non-mutually-beneficial relationships are not real relationships.
nowi.definition: connected, related, joined; complementary, mutual; exchange
nowi.etymology: nối: Vietnamese, to join, to add, to unite, to connect. to continue, to carry on, to perpetuate

nu.definition: (word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)

nusun.commentary: Coined by jan Sonja after she was asked for a word beginning with "nu", for use in sitelen pona cartouches using nasin sitelen kalama.
nusun.etymology: nujum: Malay, astrology, fortune-telling, predicting the future. fortune-teller, oracle. star

okepuma.etymology: okay boomer: 英文, okay boomer

oki.commentary: Though it may have many possible origins, it was first coined in a small group chat. It is mostly used as a variant of the toki pona words "oke" and "ke"
oki.etymology: okie: 英文, 好; okay: 英文, 好

olala.commentary: this is a hard word to explain and you've got to use it right. It's pretty much linked to anything you could use "oh là  là" or "ouh là là" for. But because it's now a full-fledged toki pona content word, it got even more powerful and versatile. It can be used for joy, surprise, excitement, admiration, compassion, empathy, sadness, disappointment, and even to show you’re interested in someone romantically. However, it's equally important (or more) to know when to *not* use the word, you wouldn’t want to commit a faux-pas!

omekalike.definition: (proper name) a song by jan Usawi, (literally) "o moku e kala ike" (eat a bad fish)
omekalike.etymology: o moku e kala ike: 托基波納 (toki pona), 'eat a bad fish', wishing somebody harm instead of well; o moku e kala pona: 托基波納 (toki pona), 'eat a good fish', wishing somebody well

omen.commentary: Originally an initialism of "o moli e mi" ("omem"); compare the formations of "peto" and "kuntu".
omen.etymology: o moli e mi: 托基波納 (toki pona), 'kill me', express exasperation or frustration sarcastically

oni.commentary:
This word is deprecated by the creator; it is considered part of the "toki oni" tokiponido instead.
The pronunciation of the second syllable was due to personal preferences of the creator, not modern Greek.
oni.definition: dream, daydream, imaginative play, vision, mystical state; to entrance

onono.etymology: oh no: 英文, oh no

pa.definition: (interjection) bruh; expression of disbelief, exasperation, or excitement

panke.definition: 1. pan palisa Panke | 2. something typical of French culture | 3. calque-ing the French language when speaking toki pona.
panke.etymology: pan: 托基波納 (toki pona); baguette: French

papa2.commentary: Several (different?) people in 2019-2021 weirdly kept putting "papa" in their Reddit / Facebook posts, seemingly to promote it as a word to other people. It caused a backlash, with other people criticising the coinage, and coining other meanings for "papa".

pasila.definition: good, easy; simple, relaxed, peaceful, uncomplicated
pasila.etymology: facile: 阿卡迪亞法文, easy; facila: Esperanto, easy

pata.etymology: брат (brat): Serbo-Croatian, brother; brata: Tok Pisin, sibling or cousin of the same gender; brother: 英文, brother

pela.commentary: A reference to Sacha Baron Cohen's interview with Noah Chomsky.

peto.commentary: Originally an initialism of "pana e telo oko"; compare the formations of "omen" and "kuntu".
peto.etymology: pana e telo oko: 托基波納 (toki pona), (incomplete sentence) 'give eye-water', to cry

pipo.etymology: pipi: 托基波納 (toki pona), bug, insect, arachnid

pipolo.definition: something that is supposed to be “kikolo” but isn't
pipolo.etymology: kikolo: 托基波納 (toki pona); pipo: 托基波納 (toki pona)

pokasi.definition: poggies, pog, poggers (interjection indicating excitement); epic, cool, amazing, exciting

polinpin.etymology: bowling pin: 英文, 保齡球釘

pomotolo.commentary: From the time management method developed by Francesco Cirillo in Berlin in the 1980s, for which people often used tomato-shaped timers. In ku, "pomotolo" was given as one of the translations of "tomato", presumably due to speakers misusing or misunderstanding the word.

poni.commentary: Occasionally comes up as a jokish corruption of "pona" (especially in a phrase "toki poni").
poni.definition: pony (of or relating to the My Little Pony franchise)

positu.definition: the life, universe, and everything else

pulaso.etymology: blue: 英文, blue; laso: 托基波納 (toki pona), blue, green

salu.commentary: 💭 Intended as an experiment in its current form, and is not meant for widespread use at this time. Meant to be used alongside a nasin that does not use either ike or pona to express value judgements (especially morality). These words are often used in a way that ignores the reasoning behind the judgement. The goal of this experimental nasin is to promote mindfulness about value itself, translating mere reaction into introspection and explanation. ⚠️ Because of the stated attachment to this particular nasin pi toki pona, it should be noted that using salu and pona/ike as good/bad at the same time goes against the point of the word's creation, and that salu is redundant in this circumstance. If you are using one, you should not use the other.
salu.definition: comfort, security, safety, stability; attention, care, caution

samu.commentary: Coined in reference to jan Samu, a Facebook user who attempted to propose a new word.
samu.etymology: jan Samu: 托基波納 (toki pona), jan Samu

sikako.commentary: sikeko is a common misspelling from tokiponists who believe "sikako" derives from "sike ko".

sikomo.commentary: Coined in reference to the Travis Scott song ‘Sicko Mode’.
sikomo.definition: on a higher tier/plane, enlighten(ed), epic; to an exceedingly great extent
sikomo.etymology: sicko mode: 英文, sicko mode

silapa.commentary:
Customarily written on multiple lines with a long "neck" composed of the letter "i" (originally the first "a"), like so:
si
 i
 ilapa

sipi.commentary: Proposed on a forum and quickly forgotten. Notable only for being an early non pu word proposal.
sipi.etymology: sibi (dative reflexive pronoun): Latin, sibi (dative reflexive pronoun)

sipije.etymology: TBH creature: 英文; TBH: 英文, to be honest

siwala.definition: the quality of being outside of understanding but accepted as reality; the quality of being not wished to be understood by one for the benefits associated with not understanding
siwala.etymology: tiwalà: Tagalog, trust. faith (in someone or something). reliance, confidence, belief

slape.etymology: lape: 托基波納 (toki pona), sleep, rest; sleep: 英文, sleep

snoweli.commentary: Originally a sitelen pona glyph with no definition, created for fun and submitted to linja lipamanka. It grew popular after its inclusion in the font "sitelen seli kiwen", after which it has come to have a definition and seen some use.
snoweli.definition: soweli with relation to the snow or cold, soweli living in predominantly cold or snowy environments (often light-colored); arctic fox
snoweli.etymology: snowman: English, snowman; soweli: toki pona, fuzzy creature, land animal, beast

sole.commentary: May refer to a state prior to a kama.
sole.definition: pattern, constant, unchanged, unaltered, unaffected; instinct, habit, to use to, to tend to
sole.etymology: soler: Spanish, to use to, to tend to

su1.definition: [yes/no question marker, replacing the role of li]

suke.commentary: The typo was made by jan Sonja while writing ku. The absolute majority of the community does not treat it as a newly coined word.
suke.etymology: typo of sike: 托基波納 (toki pona), circle, sphere, cycle

sulaso.definition: cyan, turquoise, teal, aquamarine, sky blue, light blue, light blueish
sulaso.etymology: cyan: 英文, the color between blue and green on the visible spectrum of light; laso: 托基波納 (toki pona), blue, green

sunta.commentary: Part of a system with kewe to express the colors seen by someone with tritanopia (blue-yellow colorblindness).
sunta.etymology: suno: toki pona, light, shine, glow, radiance. sun, light source. brightness; uta: toki pona, mouth, lips, throat, consuming orifice

suwili.etymology: soweli: 托基波納 (toki pona); suwi: 托基波納 (toki pona)

ta.commentary: Follows a semantically consistent pattern of "SUBJ li PV ta PRED" = "SUBJ li PV e [SUBJ li PRED]" or "[SUBJ li PRED] li PV". The top and bottom lines of the sitelen pona may be extended to the left around the pre-predicate word(s).

tankala.commentary: One-off coinage by Sonja Lang after asking about neologisms for directions.

tasun.commentary: Coined as a challenge to font creators. The sitelen pona glyph can be extended horizontally. This is usually represented in Latin characters by additional a's, e.g. "taaasun".

teki.definition: case, circumstance, situation, event, state (of affairs, being), status

ten.etymology: tenpo: 托基波納 (toki pona), time, event, situation

tenkala.commentary: Variant of tankala, suggested at the same time as an alternate tokiponization of the etymon.

tokana.definition: focus, attention, concentrate, resolution, fineness; focus on

toma.commentary: The typo was made by jan Sonja while writing ku. The absolute majority of the community does not treat it as a newly coined word.
toma.etymology: typo of tomo: 托基波納 (toki pona), home, room, house, building

tona.commentary: This word was only coined to make the spoonerism "poki tona" have a meaning.

towoki.etymology: toki: 托基波納 (toki pona), hello; OwO: emoticon, cat-like surprised face

u.definition: (word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)

uka.commentary: Part of a system with kelo to express the colors seen by someone with protanopia or deuteranopia (red-green colorblindness).
uka.etymology: uta: toki pona, mouth, lips, throat, consuming orifice; kasi: toki pona, plant, vegetation. herb, leaf

umesu.commentary: Created for the game Acrophobia (musi Ako) in response to the fact that there are few words starting with 'u' in Toki Pona.
umesu.definition: amaze people by being on the top of the leaderboard of a toki pona game
umesu.etymology: Umeyz: Iqglic, to amaze (someone), surprise, impress

waken.etymology: wuggen: 英文, non-standard plural of "wug"; wug: 英文, imaginary creature resembling a bird

waleja.commentary: May be used as a preposition, e.g. "lipu waleja toki pona = a book about toki pona". However, this usage is very rare.
waleja.definition: context, topic, salience, pertinent, topical, pertain to, be relevant
waleja.etymology: valdea: Quenya, of moment, important; valda: Quenya, worth, worthy, dear

wawajete.commentary: Coined in reference to wuwojiti, a sequence of all phonotactically unviable CV syllables in toki pona.
wawajete.definition: something that appears to break the rules but doesn't; faux edginess, provocation
wawajete.etymology: wuwojiti: 托基波納 (toki pona), (all the phonotactically unviable CV syllables in Toki Pona)

we1.definition: (acts as a transition from one complete sentence to another)
we1.etymology: güey: Spanish, man; man: 英文, man (sentence tag)

wiwi.definition: yes absolutely!, (strong) agreement, consent, to approve e <something>

yutu.commentary: The "y" was a typo and was meant to be "j", but got kept in anyway; compare "yupekosi".
yutu.definition: the star emoji used for the starboard #pona-kulupu in the ma pona pi toki pona Discord server
